intro: Epilobium obcordatum, commonly known as narrowleaf willowherb, is a herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist soils along stream banks, wet meadows, and other riparian habitats. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is often found in disturbed or wetland environments. Epilobium obcordatum is an important plant for pollinators and can be used in ecological restoration projects.
